reviews.title: Health-Conscious Antacid with Mixed Taste
reviews.content: Being prone to occasional acid reflux, I often rely on store-brand antacids from retailers like Target or Walmart. They typically offer a range of fruity flavors that make them quite palatable, akin to Smarties candy.Enter Wonder Belly Antacid, boasting a formula free from talc, dyes, parabens, and artificial sweeteners. Intrigued by its health-conscious composition, I eagerly tried it, only to find the taste falling short of expectations.Despite my initial excitement for its purported health benefits, the taste of Wonder Belly Antacid left much to be desired. While I value natural ingredients, the flavor didn't quite hit the mark for me. Nonetheless, prioritizing health over taste, I'm inclined to continue consuming it.Additionally, I observed that the product comes in an aluminum bottle, packaged within a small cardboard box. While I appreciate the effort to minimize harmful ingredients, I couldn't help but feel the cardboard packaging was unnecessary and wasteful.In summary, Wonder Belly Antacid presents a health-conscious option for managing acid reflux, but its taste may not appeal to everyone. While I commend its natural formulation, improvements could be made in flavor and packaging efficiency.

reviews.title: Not as chalky as others
reviews.content: I don’t use antacids often, but my boyfriend does. He usually gets Tums or the store brand version, and I don’t like these when I find myself needing some.The Wonderbelly antacids are much less chalky in the mouth than the tums or their generic versions. Instructions state to let them sit in the mouth for a few seconds and that makes them easier to chew through. I much prefer the texture of these.I am also allergic to red food coloring and love that these have no food dyes.They also come in an aluminum can. Sticker seal on outside and a foil seal under the cap.One tab helps soothe the heartburn quickly.This strawberry milkshake flavor tastes like a strawberry milkshake, but I prefer the mint version because I miss that cooling sensation with this flavor.I think these are really pricey for regular antacid users because you’ll be going through them rather quickly, but if you are like me and you use them once in a blue moon then they are definitely worth it.To see the photos I attached more clearly, while on a computer right click and select ‘Open image in new tab’ for the full sized image.

reviews.title: Need to think about the value
reviews.content: I usually don't mention price, but in this case, the shopper would really need to justify paying $.24 (as of 10/9/22) per tablet for these. They are upfront about the fact the active ingredient is exactly the same as in many other antacid tablets. I used these and they work the same as the big name products, but I'm pretty sure if you frequently consume antacids, you are not going to shell out 4 times more per tablet than, say, Tums Naturals, which have the same amount of calcium carbonate and check off a couple of the same sales points as this product.They may be worth it if you are sensitive to any unnatural or unnecessary ingredients, like dyes or sweeteners, which some other brands may or may not contain. And they do come in cute aluminum cans, that probably have a greater chance of actually getting recycled than plastic containers. Then again, 180 of these tablets come in 3 containers versus 1 container for the same amount of the name brands (as of this writing, these only seem to be offered in 60 tablet cans).It's up to you. My 3 star rating is meant to indicate the pluses and minuses could go either way, depending on the shopper.

reviews.title: Decent Chewable Option
reviews.content: This pack of gas relief tablets arrived quickly and well packaged. The product packaging is clearly labeled to what the contents of the package are. The tin includes 42 chewable simethicone tablets in the Mango Smoothie flavor. A serving size is 1-2 tablets for anyone 12 years old and up, meaning a jar can give you 21-42 servings. This has easily identifiable and limited ingredients that make this a clean option. The tablets taste okay, though don’t really speak to a mango smoothie flavor. They are easy to chew but I did find that they get caked in my teeth and leave an awkward texture in my mouth. These do help with bloating and gas discomfort, though I can’t say they are an effective as a pill form. The price point for this is comparable to what I’ve seen it at my local store. Overall, these are a good option for those who don’t like to take pills or those who have dietary restrictions, but the texture and limited potency does impact whether I would buy this again in the future. Would recommend to specific buyers.

reviews.title: Dry, chalky, flavorless, and expensive
reviews.content: I don’t like the flavor of these. They taste chalky. There is a little bit of flavoring, but it isn’t pronounced. These aren’t sweet, so that’s a plus if you don’t like sweet flavors. It’s like eating a regular calcium supplement that has only been very mildly sweetened. The tablets are very dry and stick to your mouth. You really need water to get these down. The safety seal isn’t very safe. Instead of a seal that covers the entire inside of the bottle, there is just a single strip of metallic tape that runs down one side of the lid and can. You could easily lift the un-taped side of the can, tamper with the product, and re-seal it to make it look new. I really don’t like taking medicine this way. I would rather swallow pills than try to chew this dry, chalky, nearly flavorless tablet. Also, at $11.99 for one bottle, they are expensive for simethicone and calcium, which are very common. You can find them all over on Amazon for cheaper.

reviews.title: Vanilla Strawberry Tablets Stuck to my teeth, Safety Seal easily tampered with
reviews.content: I have been a fan of Simethicone for years. While I consider the well known brand (G__Ex) to be a staple of our "first aid" cabinet, this one works, but does not appeal in the same way to me . That said, here's my longer review with more details:Company Transparency: Trademark Activity for “Wonderbelly” is first noted in 2021. They have a really cute and information dense webpage with an “About Us” that says their Ginger Health company was started by Lucas Kraft (who’d struggled with gut issues) and his business oriented brother Noah. They “put together an amazing team of gastroenterologists and pharmaceutical scientists” to create products that don’t  use ingredients like dyes, talc, or artificial sweeteners (note: That doesn't mean "filler free"). They provide biographies of their team of three medical advisors!Accountability for Safety: They claim to be  "clean label project" certified, vegan, non-GMO, and free of artificial dyes, artificial sweeteners, talc, titanium dioxide, parabens, gluten and dairy. Although most of  Wonderbelly's antacids are verifiably Clean Label Project Certified (checks for things like lead, purity), I don’t see this product listed at the Clean Label Project webpage (yet?). (In theory the CL Project certification *might*  be as good as GMP certified, even better in a sense, because it tests store bought product that is purchased anonymously, not samples provided by the company. And then they do spot checks periodically. Genius!) (Disclaimer: Just my uneducated opinion about the value of the testing).Quality: Unfortunately the unique safety seal on this is easily tampered with. I can lift it and replace it so that it looks like it did originally. Otherwise, this container includes 42 chewable simethicone tablets that each contain 125 mg of Simethicone, which is the same amount as Gas-Ex Extra strength. They recommend taking 1-3 tablets with symptoms. They have a strong vanilla/strawberry scent, and taste the same (not personally a fan).  They don't dissolve quickly as I chew, but are dry and become a damp clump that sticks to my teeth. The ingredients are said to be “Clean”.  They seem to work for me, bringing quick relief (simethicone is great).I was happy to see other folks enjoyed these, because although I love strawberry shortcake, these just didn't do it for me. They stuck to and filled in the crevices of my molars so that the taste lingered for a long time (I have lots of dental work, so maybe that's the issue?), but I love the "Clean Label project" quality verification idea and that some of Wonderbelly's products can be verified in that program!
reviews.type: Amazon Vine Customer Review of Free Product
